722706f-a.text:
Riverside Drive, from and including 78th to and including 79th Streets, as seen from the park on the west side of the "drive'.
June 11, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

714558f-a.text:
West 78th Street, east from but not including Riverside Drive.
July 27, 1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Art Project.

733246f-b.title: Squatters Colony at the Hudson River.
733246f-b.text:
(1) Shacks of unemployed squatters on the Hudson River (west of the N.Y.C. R. R. Tracks), between 72nd and 73rd Streets.  (In the background is the New Jersey Shore).

September 29, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)  Another view in the same section.

Summer 1923. (?)

P. L. Sperr.

(3)  Another unemployed individuals home at about 78th Street.  Note on the right of No. 1 a partial view of Camp Thomas Paine, A B.E.F. encampment, for which see files under that classification.

September 29, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(Not a dru mount item).
733246f-b.folder: 78th Street and Riverside Drive, Manhattan, N.Y.
